result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A. Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Judge Slate and reporter appear by video.
01:19 PM Defendant Nicholas A. Rivera in court.  Atty Margaret Fichter appears by video.
Defendant makes statement to the Court.  Agent states balance of restitution.  BY THE COURT:  Court states if restitution can be paid off by the end of probation, the fines can be converted to civil judgment.  Will review at end of probation.
Extending Probation
Probation review hearing on May 4, 2021 at 01:00 pm.

01:21 PM Defendant Nicholas A. Rivera in court. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Court questions defendant on payment of restitution.  Defendant states he was scheduled to be on probation for another year.  Court notes he put this hearing on to see why it has taken such time to pay restitution.  Defendant responds.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will extend probation for a period of 1 year and will review this in 6 months.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.


**Clerk to notify DOC  Probation review hearing scheduled for May 4, 2021 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Discharge rescinded
nunc pro tunc
to Extend Probation
and Stipulation to Waive Appearance/Hearing to Extend Probation

01:34 PM Defendant Nicholas A. Rivera in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant has not paid the restitution in full.  Court received a letter from Agent Bennett that probation was requesting a review because the defendant still owed restitution; that is why today's hearing was set.  

BY THE COURT:  Court notes that a discharge certificate has been filed for the defendant.  

Defendant makes a statement to the court.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds that good faith has not been made and will extend the Probation for 1 year.  If the dept. has filed the certificate in error than the probation will be extended.  If the department filed the certificate correctly, than the restitution will be converted to a civil judgment.
COC office to call department to see if the certificate was filed in error.

Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)
Treatment Court Hearing on January 19, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas A. Rivera in court with attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF14 & 15CF96 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant will be entering into Treatment Court Program.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CF14 & Counts 1 & 2 of 15CF96.  Counts 3 & 4 in 15CF96 to be dismissed and read-in.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of:  24 months with conditions on 15CF96. 
 Atty Wilsnack agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1 in 15CF14.  
Court accepts defendant's plea on Counts 1 & 2 in 15CF96 and approves and signs the 24 month DPA with conditions. Counts 3 & 4 in 15CF96 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee asks the court to have jail commence forthwith.
Atty Wilsnack makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to have the jail report time to be Monday.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  15CF14:  TREATMENT COURT:
Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*12 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; 8 months will be stayed for the use of Treatment Court violations
  Report on January 6, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*Huber to include treatment purposes including treatment court
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample + $250 Surcharge
*Restitution = $3,026.00 + $302.60 surcharge = $3,328.60; Joint and Several with Derek J. Martz 15CF13, Jacob J. Hardman 14CF97, Brian E. DeVore 14CF100, & Thomas S. Fraley 14CF101.
*Participation in and successful graduation from Marquette County Treatment Court
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Maintain full-time employment
*Establish a monthly payment plan for restitution as recommended by the Agent

15CF96:  Counts 1 & 2:  Court approves the 24 month DPA with conditions.
Counts 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Nicholas A. Rivera in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Zamzow states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Zamzow states that there is a conflict and will be withdrawing from the case.  Atty Zamzow will contact the PD office to get other counsel appointed.
Atty Zamzow states that the defendant will waive the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.  Set Prelim.

Atty Bonnett requests a Signature bond with conditions.
Atty Zamzow has no objection.
